solution_line_template: Bowen bought {pencil_more_fraction_num}/{pencil_more_fraction_den} * {num_pens} pens = <<{pencil_more_fraction_num}/{pencil_more_fraction_den}*{num_pens}={more_pencils}>>{more_pencils} more pencils than pens.
The total number of pencils that he bought is {num_pens} pencils + {more_pencils} pencils = <<{num_pens}+{more_pencils}={total_pencils}>>{total_pencils} pencils

If each pencil costs twenty-five cents, the total amount of money he spent on pencils is {total_pencils} pencils * ${pencil_price}/pencil = $<<{total_pencils}*{pencil_price}={pencil_total_cost}>>{pencil_total_cost}
The total amount of money Bowen spent is ${pencil_total_cost} + ${pen_total_cost} = $<<{pencil_total_cost}+{pen_total_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}
